title: Multitude of the Heavens - cultural tradition

content.description:
Nasir al-Din Abu al-Abbas Ahmad ibn al-Hajj al-Amin al-Tawathi al-Ghalawi, The Important Stars Among the Multitude of the Heavens, Copied 1733, Timbuktu, Mali
Library of Congress, Mamma Haidara Commemorative Library
This source was written to train scholars in the field of astronomy and includes explanations written in Arabic, the primary language of Islam.
content.question: Which of the following statements best supports the idea that this document was created in a place with a rich cultural tradition?

choices.label: Proximity to seas and oceans supported the development of early societies and fostered early global connections in Africa.
The Bantu linguistic family contains hundreds of languages that are spoken throughout West, Central, and Southern Africa.
Griots were respected historians and storytellers who maintained and shared a community’s history in West Africa.
Variations in climate facilitated diverse opportunities for trade in Africa.

content.answer: Griots were respected historians and storytellers who maintained and shared a community’s history in West Africa.
